Name: Homemade machine learning
Author: Trekhleb, O. (Uber)
Description: "This repository contains examples of popular machine learning algorithms implemented in Python with mathematics behind them being explained. Each algorithm has interactive Jupyter Notebook demo that allows you to play with training data, algorithms configurations and immediately see the results, charts and predictions right in your browser. In most cases the explanations are based on this great machine learning course by Andrew Ng."

Name: CRISP-DM: The dominant process for Data Mining
Author: Brown, M. (PyData)
Description: Explanation of CRISP-DM.

Name: Applied Machine Learning: Feature Engineering
Author: LinkedIn Learning
Description: The quality of the predictions coming out of your machine learning model is a direct reflection of the data you feed it during training. Feature engineering helps you extract every last bit of value out of data. This course provides the tools to take a data set, tease out the signal, and throw out the noise in order to optimize your models.

Description: Overview of books on different topics related to ML.

Author: Rohrer, F.
Description: "A curated list of awesome resources for practicing data science using Python, including not only libraries, but also links to tutorials, code snippets, blog posts and talks."

Author: Fritz.ai
Description: "A list of awesome mobile machine learning resources curated by Fritz AI." Libraries, code and tutorials for using ML on mobile devices.

Author: Nielsen, M.

Name: Dive into Deep Learning
Author: Zhang, A. (Amazon)
Description: Online available for free. "An interactive deep learning book with code, math, and discussions, based on the NumPy interface."

Name: From Data to Viz
Author: Holtz, Y.
Description: "From Data to Viz leads you to the most appropriate graph for your data. It links to the code to build it and lists common caveats you should avoid."

Name: The Super Duper NLP Repo
Author: Quantum Stat
Description: List of Google Colab notebooks for NLP

Name: Efficient Processing of Deep Neural Networks: A Tutorial and Survey
Author: Sze et al.
Description: This article aims to provide a comprehensive tutorial and survey about the recent advances towards the goal of enabling efficient processing of DNNs. Specifically, it will provide an overview of DNNs, discuss various hardware platforms and architectures that support DNNs, and highlight key trends in reducing the computation cost of DNNs either solely via hardware design changes or via joint hardware design and DNN algorithm changes.

Name: Choosing the right estimator
Author: Scikit-learn
Description: Often the hardest part of solving a machine learning problem can be finding the right estimator for the job. Different estimators are better suited for different types of data and different problems. The flowchart below is designed to give users a bit of a rough guide on how to approach problems with regard to which estimators to try on your data.

Name: Automated machine learning
Author: KI Campus
Description: The course on "Automated Machine Learning" addresses the challenge of designing well-performing machine learning (ML) pipelines, including their hyperparameters, architectures of deep neural networks and pre-processing. Future ML developers will learn how to use and design automated approaches for determining such ML pipelines efficiently. The course is designed either to be taken as a MOOC or can be offered by universities in a blended learning format with face-to-face and online phases.

Name: Deep learning
Author: University of Liège
Description: Lectures for INFO8010 - Deep Learning, ULiège, Spring 2021.

Name: MLOps: Continuous delivery and automation pipelines in machine learning
Author: Google
Description: This document discusses techniques for implementing and automating continuous integration (CI), continuous delivery (CD), and continuous training (CT) for machine learning (ML) systems.

Name: Awesome production machine learning
Author: Ethical Institute
Description: This repository contains a curated list of awesome open source libraries that will help you deploy, monitor, version, scale, and secure your production machine learning.

Name: LF AI & Data Foundation landscape
Description: Overview of AI/data-related frameworks, platforms, libraries, etc.

Name: Machine Learning Engineering for Production (MLOps) Specialization
Author: Deeplearning.ai
Description: The Machine Learning Engineering for Production (MLOps) Specialization covers how to conceptualize, build, and maintain integrated systems that continuously operate in production. In striking contrast with standard machine learning modeling, production systems need to handle relentless evolving data.

Name: MLOps (Machine Learning Operations) Fundamentals
Author: Google
Description: This course introduces participants to MLOps tools and best practices for deploying, evaluating, monitoring and operating production ML systems on Google Cloud.
